preface.title: Demoiselle Audit
preface.para: The Demoiselle Audit was created to meet a need that the community had a way of historicizing the events of the applications developed with Demoiselle Framework. Since early as the concept of the component seek technologies, and literary references on industry standards, best practices and what information would be capable of registering a moment and make it an input for a possible audit.

We use two main sources of reference COBIT and NIST. We suggest that these sources are used as the basis for the effective implementation of a consistent process so that in case of audit the same is valid. The Demoiselle Audit is only one piece in the set of procedures which guarantee a good audit, only the use of the component is not enough in cases of lawsuits, and the confiabialidade invioalabilidade must be guaranteed for such information to be considered relevant.

O Demoiselle Audit é dividido em três módulos e uma implementação de um dashboard para auxilio no desenvolvimento.
Core Main module of the system funicona with an aggregator to support pluggability of Auditors and Processors and has fault tolerance mechanism.
Auditores The module responsible for observing and capturing application information and send to the Core. implementation Reference Auditor will capture the persistence layer of the application running in conjunction with JPA collecting the data immediately after the CRUD operation has been completed.
Processadores The person responsible for completion of the procedure, module, ie it has the task to continue the track element. The reference implementation of the processor sends a REST service, but there may be implementations where they are sent to a NoSQL database, the same database application, or even a messaging service.
Dashboard This implementation is not part of the operating mechanism Demoiselle Audit, but serves as a tool support the implementation and development of the component, it consists of four types of visualizations persisted the Demoiselle Audit and contains a REST service that receives the path generated by the implementation of Reference Processor, supporting the implementation of the component.
